intro: Bupleurum rigidum subsp. eurigidum, commonly known as the rigid milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to the arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, somewhat woody stems that are often branched. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in racemes, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately compound, and have a rough, hairy texture. It is adapted to dry environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
